items.title: New US National Parks Fees For International Visitors Draw Scrutiny
bullets: • Prices for non-U.S
• residents to purchase an “America the Beautiful” pass, which grants the holder access to all of the country’s national parks for a year, will more than triple, rising from $80 to $250
• The department is also instituting a new $100 fee for those who visit one of the county's 11 most popular parks

• Environmental groups fear the price change could threaten revenue for the National Park Service, which is already reeling from staffing cuts imposed by President Donald Trump's second administration

items.title: ULA aimed to launch up to 10 Vulcan rockets this year—it will fly just once
bullets: • Last year, United Launch Alliance said it would launch as many as 20 missions this year
• Now, it's likely that ULA will close out 2025 with six flights, five with the Atlas V and one with the Vulcan rocket
• The Vulcan rocket’s sole launch this year occurred August 12, when it took off on a mission sponsored by the US Space Force

items.title: Review – Shelby Oaks (2025) hints at something different, but can’t keep its promises
bullets: • Shelby Oaks is a muddled, uneven experiment that never quite figures out what it wants to be
• It swings between cinematic sequences, faux-documentary interviews, and found-footage snippets with little sense of cohesion
• What starts as a promising premise erodes into a greatest-hits compilation of genre clichés

• Today, researchers understand that fever is part of the immune system's response to a pathogen
• But how they can help kick an infection remains mysterious
